item.title: adventurer
item.description: this set might be based on herman. [[content/notes/items/artifacts/flower of life|adventurer’s flower]] “A resilient flower that survived the harsh environment of [[an ancient city]].

item.title: artifacts
item.description: something i keep noticing about artifact lore is that it’s rarely linear. reading from [[content/notes/items/artifacts/flower of life]] to [[content/notes/items/artifacts/circlet of logos]] is never going to tell you a story from beginning to end.

item.title: berserker
item.description: we don’t know who the berserker is, where his homeland was, what time period he lived in, or much of what happened to him.

item.title: circlet of logos
item.description: logos is one of the three pillars of rhetoric, along with pathos and ethos. in that context, it represents reason and logic.

item.title: flower of life
item.description: i’ve noticed that sometimes the flower piece is literally a flower (though never a flower we’ve actually seen anywhere in teyvat, as far as i know), and other times it’s a brooch of some sort.

item.title: goblet of eonothem
item.description: what’s an eonothem? according to wikipedia, an eonothem is “the totality of rock strata laid down during a certain eon of the geologic timescale,” but i barely understand what that means.

item.title: initiate
item.description: the initiate artifact set is unobtainable — you only see it on trial characters in quest domains. the only two pieces are the [[content/notes/items/artifacts/flower of life|flower of life]] and [[content/notes/items/artifacts/plume of death|plume of death]].

item.title: instructor
item.description: i haven’t looked into this set very much, so i have no theories about it yet. but there’s a comment on the wiki page that says:

item.title: lucky dog
item.description: i don’t have any guesses as to who this artifact series is about, but it reminds me a lot of [[bennett]] — except bennett is obviously known to be very unlucky.

item.title: plume of death
item.description: sometimes the plume of death is a feather that has been plucked from or dropped by a bird, and sometimes it’s taken from an arrow.

item.title: resolution of sojourner
item.description: this artifact set is — surprise! — about [[the sojourner]] of the [[wanderers’ troupe]]. it tells part of the story of the four members meeting each other and forming the troupe, as well as their failed uprising against the mondstadt aristocrats.

item.title: sands of eon
item.description: a lot of my thoughts & explanations on eons are [[content/notes/items/artifacts/goblet of eonothem|over here]], where i wrote about the “goblet of eonothem.

item.title: tiny miracle
item.description: this set seems to be referencing the fall of the [[notes/characters/three moon sisters]], which overturned the [[content/notes/reference/motifs/moon|moon]] chariot & “laid ruin to the halls of the stars.

item.title: traveling doctor
item.description: [[content/notes/items/artifacts/flower of life|traveling doctor’s silver lotus]] “A precious medicinal ingredient that has lost all medicinal value after years in storage.”
